theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production as primary aging driver and mitochondrial DNA damage leading to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial free radical generation sites and species-specific longevity linked to mitochondrial ROS.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial oxygen radical generation, mitochondrial DNA damage, and correlation with longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production, mitochondrial dysfunction, and antioxidant melatonin effects on neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: General free radical theory emphasizing free radicals from metabolism causing cumulative damage distinct from oxygen toxicity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses balance of mitochondrial free radical production and antioxidant defenses modulated by dietary restriction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-related increase in free radical formation and oxidative damage with decline in antioxidant defenses.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on free radical injury accumulation in brain aging and modifiable lifestyle factors influencing oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Relates antioxidant enzyme activity changes and lipid peroxidation in brain aging linked to free radical damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: General free radical oxidation causing cumulative damage to DNA, proteins, and lipids with aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Non-Mitochondrial ROS and NADPH Oxidase Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS from NADPH oxidase (Nox2) and lipid modulation of ROS production impacting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Non-Mitochondrial ROS and NADPH Oxidase Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes glutathione redox imbalance in neurons affecting redox homeostasis and neuronal aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Non-Mitochondrial ROS and NADPH Oxidase Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes dual role of oxygen free radicals in cellular function and aging, emphasizing semiconductive protein model.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Non-Mitochondrial ROS and NADPH Oxidase Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights peroxisomal role in ROS detoxification and aging via catalase and antioxidant enzyme decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Proteasomal Decline Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS-induced protein oxidation, accumulation of oxidized proteins, and decline in antioxidant defenses.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Proteasomal Decline Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes protein carbonylation by ROS, mitochondrial ROS contribution, and loss of protein function with aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Proteasomal Decline Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of oxidized proteins due to decreased repair and proteasomal degradation with aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Proteasomal Decline Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on proteasomal system role in degrading oxidized proteins and its age-related decline contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Proteasomal Decline Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details protein oxidation, proteasome-mediated degradation, and age-related proteasome activity decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Lipid Peroxidation and Antioxidant Enzyme Imbalance Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on imbalance of antioxidant enzymes leading to lipid peroxidation and oxidative damage in aging brain.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Relates antioxidant enzyme activity changes and lipid peroxidation marker (MDA) increases with aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Lipid Peroxidation and Antioxidant Enzyme Imbalance Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes catalase and other antioxidant enzymes in H2O2 removal and their influence on lifespan and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Lipid Peroxidation and Antioxidant Enzyme Imbalance Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses genetic control of oxidative stress resistance and antioxidant enzymes affecting lifespan and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Lipid Peroxidation and Antioxidant Enzyme Imbalance Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes stochastic accumulation of oxidative damage to macromolecules and lifespan extension by damage reduction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Lipid Peroxidation and Antioxidant Enzyme Imbalance Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage accumulation in mesenchymal progenitor cells, antioxidant decline, and senescence.
